title: fsm::Parallel
description:
Play multiple states in parallel
The state is completed when all the states it's running are completed
The default state's output is the output of the last state it's running (see "outputStates" for other behaviours)

states.description: List of states run by this state

delays.description: Delay the start of specified states (in seconds)

configs.description: Override configuration for the state running inside this FSM

outputs.description:
List of state names for which the transition will be generated from the state output.
  • When omitted or empty the output of the last state in the "states" property will be used.
  • When state names are provided, the transition output is generated according to the following pattern: "State1(state1 output), State2(state2 output)". For example a typical Parallel state output might look like: "CoM(eval), TrajectoryState(timeElapsed AND wrench)"

AddContacts.description: Add the specified contacts during the state's start

RemoveContacts.description: Remove the specified contacts during the state's start

AddContactsAfter.description: Add the specified contacts during the state's teardown

RemoveContactsAfter.description: Remove the specified contacts during the state's teardown

AddColissions.description: Add the specified collisions during the state's start

RemoveColissions.description: Remove the specified collisions during the state's start

AddColissionsAfter.description: Add the specified collisions during the state's teardown

RemoveColissionsAfter.description: Remove the specified collisions during the state's teardown

RemovePostureTask.description: If true, remove the main robot posture task at the state's start
